newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin returns to Moscow after summit.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin returns to Moscow after summit.

text.p: President Boris Yeltsin returned to Moscow on Monday after attending a summit of the Group of Seven main industrialised nations in the U.S. city of Denver, the Kremlin said.
"The president has arrived at (the government) Vnukovo-2 airport," a spokeswoman said.

Yeltsin hailed the summit as a success for Russia, which won admission to the Paris Club of creditor nations and gained the backing of G7 leaders for its bid to join other global economic organisations.

But he also triggered fresh concern about his health on Saturday when he missed a late-night gala concert. He resurfaced on Sunday looking well and refreshed and aides said he had just been tired after a heavy schedule of talks.
Asked about his health on Monday, the Kremlin spokeswoman said the president was probably tired after his long flight but otherwise fine.
Yeltsin, who has a history of mysterious disappearing acts, had open heart surgery last November.

The G7 includes the United States, Japan, Germany, France, Britain, Italy and Canada. Russia is not a formal member but Russian officials say the gathering has effectively become the G8 as Yeltsin attended all but one of the summit events.
